Author: newvulcan#9571
Content:
Hi, I'm having some problems with finding ZEX blocks on my mining pool. All other coins are working fine including KMD, ARRR, ZCL and HUSH. I'm using S-NOMP with the following config file for ZEX:{
"name": "ZADDEX",
"symbol": "ZEX",
"algorithm": "equihash",
"sapling": true,
"requireShielding": true
}
My komodod command line is: ./komodod -ac_founders=1 -addnode=5.9.102.210 -ac_name=ZEX -ac_reward=13000000000 -ac_pubkey=039d4a50cc70d1184e462a22edb3b66385da97cc8059196f8305c184a3e21440af -ac_cc=2 -ac_halving=525600 

The error that NPM throws is  "We thought a block was found, but it was rejected by the daemon"

The matching error line in the debug file is ERROR: ProcessNewBlock: CheckBlock FAILED

My guess is that something is wrong with one of the config files above. Just to add tried the same thing with knomp and got the same errors

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: @newvulcan the answers you seek can be found in https://github.com/blackjok3rtt/node-stratum-pool

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: P.S. -NPM isn't throwing that error, your pool software is

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @newvulcan probably related to your pool not dealing with founder reward correctly
